p: However, limited attention has so far been devoted to the nutritive properties of various silkworm mutants, in particular, coloured cocoon strain mutants, including yellow and golden yellow. Despite their lower silk productivity, such less explored strains retain some interesting biological characteristics, such as higher resistance to diseases and the ability to absorb carotenoids and flavonoids from the feed substrates [ 19]. Such pigments enhance protection against UV radiation through antioxidants [ 20] and serve the feedstuff industry (particularly fish farming and poultry industry) by imparting desired coloration to flesh [ 21] and eggs [ 22].
